page.title: 18Local Study 2
page.content: There are a number of important houses in our area. There is April Cottage which is probably the oldest house in Ashton. It was built in the fourteenth century as a woodcutter's cottage. It has a thatched roof and recently has had an extension built. The present Peel Hall was built in 1637. King William III is known to have slept at Peel Hall. There is a moat at the hall which is probably one of Ashton's oldest links with the past. Other notable buildings include Mouldsworth Hall, the present residence having been built on the site of an earlier Tudor house; Ashton Heyes, whose history as an estate dates back to the time of William the Conqueror; and, Ashton Hall at present a modern arable and dairy farm.
